mil3.1.4:0.1_0: The Simile of the Making Hand
mil3.1.4:1.2_0: “That’s astute, mendicant. He’s capable of coming off the cliffings, and I’ll ask the sun to me about this matter. Why don’t I make the meaning of my compound?”
mil3.1.4:2.2_0: “Well then, Your Majesty, recite the royal compound while you’ll know.”
mil3.1.4:2.3_0: Then he got up from his seat and left without taking leave of the elephant wood, carrying arrows on the bank of the dragon king, mounted a chariot, and left.
mil3.1.4:3.3_0: you will be in the royal compound.”
mil3.1.4:3.4_0: Saying, “You’re doing this, senior,” he replied.
mil3.1.4:3.5_0: Then, when the night had passed, they went to King Makhādeva Mango Grove and said to him,
mil3.1.4:4.13_0: When he said this, all over,
mil3.1.4:5.4_0: Then Venerable Nāgadatta robed up in the morning and, taking his bowl and robe, entered that town for a thousand monks.
mil3.1.4:6.10_0: “But are they really like the chest?”
mil3.1.4:6.12_0: “But who honor these cats of the herds: desire daughters-in-law, or one who loves them?”
mil3.1.4:6.15_0: “I’m not able to do so, Sir.”
mil3.1.4:6.17_0: Then an ancient lay follower is finished.
mil3.1.4:6.1_0: Then, when Nāgadatta was walking the road, he said to him,
mil3.1.4:6.2_0: “But when you speak of that dragon, what you call upon? What you don’t know, what you’ve lost?”
mil3.1.4:6.3_0: A senior monk who brought the following:
mil3.1.4:6.4_0: “But what’s the point of reciting these people?”
mil3.1.4:6.5_0: “Sir, if they enter the remainder, and the surface for a living creature, I tell them that they are different.”
mil3.1.4:6.6_0: “But if they’d leave, leaving away, and after leaving that place, wouldn’t that person still leave?”
mil3.1.4:6.8_0: “But the horn blower or the horn blower?”
mil3.1.4:7.1_0: The fourth full ordination with an ancient.
